meanings.definition: To cause (a cell) to undergo plasmolysis.
meanings.sent1: The salt solution will plasmolyze the plant cell.
meanings.sent2: If you add too much salt, the cells will plasmolyze.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous scientist wanted to plasmolyze the cells for an experiment.
meanings.sent4: The harsh conditions plasmolyzed the fragile cells, leaving them shriveled.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a magnifying glass to show how the salt can plasmolyze the cells.

meanings.sent1: The plant cells plasmolyze when placed in a hypertonic solution.
meanings.sent2: Cells will plasmolyze if they lose too much water.
meanings.sent3: The cells decided to plasmolyze to adapt to the dry environment.
meanings.sent4: As the water evaporated, the cells began to plasmolyze.
meanings.sent5: The biologist observed the cells as they started to plasmolyze under the microscope.
